meanings.sent1: The sugarcoated donut looked very sweet and delicious.
meanings.sent2: The bakery displayed a variety of sugarcoated pastries.
meanings.sent3: The ants were drawn to the sugarcoated candies left on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as a sugarcoated cupcake.
meanings.sent5: The snow outside glistened like sugarcoated crystals.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more pleasant or appealing than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement sugarcoated the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent2: She always sugarcoated her feedback to avoid hurting feelings.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to sugarcoat the bad news only made it more obvious.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to sugarcoat his controversial statement.
meanings.sent5: The reality show contestants quickly learned not to sugarcoat their opinions.
